question: Which country commissioning its first radar-evading J-20 stealth fighter jets into military service recently?
explanation: The Chengdu J-20 is China's fourth-generation medium and long-range fighter jet. China announced the commissioning of its first radar-evading J-20 stealth fighter jets into military service, in Beijing. It is a twin-engine, single seat stealth fighter. It was built by Chengdu Aerospace Corporation.
